id: bigtech:how europes new carbon tax on imported goods will change glo:2025-12-20T12:15:03.000Z
title: How Europe’s new carbon tax on imported goods will change global trade
author: Simona Sagone, The Conversation
summary_long: For people living in the European Union, the price of their next car, home renovation, and even local produce may soon reflect a climate policy that many have never even heard of. This new regulation, which comes fully into force on New Year’s Day, does not just target heavy industry—it affects everyday goods which now face an added carbon cost when they enter Europe. The carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM) puts a carbon price on many imported goods—meaning that EU-based importers will pay for the greenhouse gases emitted during the production of certain carbon-intensive materials. If goods come from countries with weaker climate rules, then the charge will be higher. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: space:artemis ii crew rehearse launch day demonstration:2025-12-20T20:31:20.000Z
title: Artemis II Crew Rehearse Launch Day Demonstration
author: Antonia Jaramillo
summary_long: The four astronauts set to fly around the Moon during NASA’s Artemis II test flight depart the Neil A. Armstrong Operations and Checkout Building at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, during a dress rehearsal for launch day on Dec. 20, 2025. From left are CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen, NASA astronauts Victor Glover, Reid Wiseman, and Christina Koch. Source: www.nasa.gov. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: space:astronauts launch teams practice artemis 2 countdown:2025-12-21T00:15:32.000Z
title: Astronauts, launch teams practice Artemis 2 countdown
author: Will Robinson-Smith
summary_long: In a prelude to the real deal, the four astronauts of the Artemis 2 mission boarded their Orion spacecraft inside the Vehicle Assembly Building at the Kennedy Space Center on Saturday afternoon. The three Americans and one Canadian participated in a launch day rehearsal referred to as the countdown demonstration test or CDDT. It was the first opportunity for everyone involved with the mission to be on hand and to go through the motions of the big day with the fully integrated rocket in the loop, instead of just data simulations. The test appeared to reach its conclusion with a cutoff of the simulated countdown at the T-29 seconds point at 5:51 p.m. Source: spaceflightnow.com. Date: 2025-12-21. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:the lcd steam deck is done:2025-12-20T16:09:55.000Z
title: The LCD Steam Deck is done
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: The most affordable Steam Deck, the $399 LCD model, is not available in the US. And, according to the Steam Deck site, it won't be coming back. Underneath the listings for the various models is a note that says: > We are no longer producing the Steam Deck LCD 256GB model. Once sold out, it will no longer be available. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:governor hochul signs new yorks ai safety act:2025-12-20T22:05:03.000Z
title: Governor Hochul signs New York's AI safety act
author: Cheyenne MacDonald
summary_long: New York governor Kathy Hochul signed legislation on Friday aimed at holding large AI developers accountable for the safety of their models. The RAISE Act establishes rules for greater transparency, requiring these companies to publish information about their safety protocols and report any incidents within 72 hours of their occurrence. It comes a few months after California adopted similar legislation. But, the penalties aren't going to be nearly as steep as they were initially presented when the bill passed back in June. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:sonys first ev with honda will let you remotely play ps5 in :2025-12-20T20:23:59.000Z
title: Sony's first EV with Honda will let you remotely play PS5 in your car
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Faraway road trips just got a lot easier, at least for the passengers. Sony Honda Mobility, the joint venture between the two Japanese conglomerates created to produce electric vehicles, announced that its Afeela EV will come with PS Remote Play. While playing video games in a car may be a niche feature, it means drivers will have something to do when parked, and passengers can chip away at their favorite RPGs during long drives. According to the announcement, the Afeela will be able to run your PS5 and PS4 consoles remotely through the infotainment system's integrated display. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:google assistant will stick around a bit longer than expecte:2025-12-20T13:00:00.000Z
title: Google Assistant will stick around a bit longer than expected for some Android users
author: Mariella Moon
summary_long: Google wanted to remove Assistant from most Android phones by the end of 2025 and replace it with Gemini. But now the company has announced that it needs a bit more time to make its AI assistant the new default digital helper for most of its users. Google said that it's adjusting its previously announced timeline to "make sure [it delivers] a seamless transition" and that updates to convert Assistant to Gemini on Android devices will continue into the next year. The company also said that it's sharing more details in the "coming months," so it's possible that the transition will go past early 2026. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: nextfrontiers:industrial solar cells achieve 2609 efficiency with reduced :2025-12-20T19:30:02.000Z
title: Industrial solar cells achieve 26.09% efficiency with reduced silver use and better bifacial performance
summary_long: A research team led by Prof. Ye Jichun from the Ningbo Institute of Materials Technology and Engineering (NIMTE) of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, in collaboration with partners, has proposed a synergistic technical solution enabling industrial tunnel oxide passivating contact (TOPCon) solar cells to simultaneously achieve high efficiency, low cost, and excellent bifacial power generation performance. Source: techxplore.com. Date: 2025-12-20. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
